Word.Root: To return to, return successively, run against, repeat, come back, follow by turns, be wound (thread).
Word.MeaningSimple: To turn against. Return. Prevail after losing. Second chance

Meaning.Definition: كَرَّ aor. يَكُرُّ inf. noun كَرًّا and كُرُوْرًا and تَكْرَارًا : He turned to or against him. اِنْهَزَمَ ثُمَّ كَرَّ عَلَيْهِ : He was put to flight, then he returned against him; he gave up his ghost. كَرَّةٌ : A return.
Meaning.Example: Token(2:168:5:7) : Would that there were for us a return (2:168); a time or one time.
Token(67:5:1:4) كَرَّتَيْنِ : Again (67:5); a turn to prevail against an opposing party.
Token(17:7:1:4) Then We gave to you the turn to prevail against them or victory over them (17:7).
